title._content: Staff Of Mine Rescue Station No. 1 At Lethbridge

description._content: 1913 12.7 x 17.8 cm 1 Black and white copy print The first trained team in Western Canada combining first aid and mine rescue work. Sign in the photograph reads "Alberta Government Mine Rescue Station No. 1, Lethbridge". Front row, left to right: Robert Clark, John Stevenson. Back row, left to right: Robert Livingstone, Michael Rebar, D. McDonald, George Coutts, John Livingstone, Alex Muir. The following information was received from George Rebar, grandson of Mike Rebar. "He (Mike Rebar) went to the Hillcrest disaster and worked a week recovering the bodies. They were not able to locate any living. Unfortunately he was not paid by the Mine nor by the WCB which meant he lost a week's wages, doing extremely hazardous work. Upon due reflection, he decided to tender his resignation with regret." Reproductions: 6 cm x 7 cm black and white copy negative To obtain high quality and larger reproductions of this image please visit the Galt Museum & Archives website: www.galtmuseum.com/archives.htm and include thIs number in your request: P19851028000
